body: @rfetishkevi You'd better create a PR to merge to master branch, I notice currently is merge to branch-2.4. If you want to contain this PR at branch-2.4, it's better to merge to master first, and then the release manager check-pick this PR to branch-2.4 If it's necessary to release 2.4.3?
@codelipenghui, ok. I'll create new PR then.

@rdhabalia The waiting for all the inflight messages should be the default current behavior (that's also what the javadoc says :) ). If that's not the case, then we should just fix the implementation but I don't think we need 2 options there.

Hi @zymap,

The way to add these features is done on https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/6428. It comes with its usage on Namespaces & ServerCnx.
@jiazhai Thanks for the review, please help to take a look again.

Closing this PR because created another one that is merged to master.
https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/6659

Need a new interface

CompletableFuture<R> apply (T input);
Thanks @sijie feedback, will close this change.

How come this is marked as a feature and not a bug?

It violates the ordering guarantee of Key_Shared, and basically makes Key_Shared useless if you dynamically add consumers.

I ask, because I would like to ensure this bug gets the proper attention, and is not regarded as a nice-to-have feature.

What is the semantic of multiple AuthZ providers? This is probably different in comparison with Authentication (eg: you can pass the credentials in multiple forms). 

For example, what would mean that providerA says I don't have access and providerB says I do?
This fork repository is deleted by mistake, so make a new fork and take this PR  to #6662.

The best way should be to specify authZ provider to use with authprovider. As multiple auth providers are supported, multiple authZ providers should be defined consequently.

The simplest way here, is if any authZ provider authorizes then go. 

WDYT?
The forms will the same for each authZ provider.
The same error occurs with Helm v3.

@merlimat 
Yes, I realized it and I already removed the API and fix the existing behavior as per java-doc. It failed many test cases so, now I have to fix them.

Thanks for this great software, and for the quick merge!

How about this
in BrokerService, create a new ScheduledExecutorService to regularly trigger "ManagedLedgerImpl#trimConsumedLedgersInBackground" of all topics
This FIPS provider is supported in #6588. It will be released in 2.5.1 & 2.6.0.

@svencowart the current yaml file in master doesn't work with 2.5.0 image. You can remove `PULSAR_PREFIX_` in those settings in bookie.yaml. I have sent a pull request to fix the yaml files in master. You can apply the change in #6671 and re-deploy the cluster.

https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/6671/files#diff-21d9f0473ce7fa9c935bc04a157315e4R29

@wmccarley 

You can use `zookeeper-shell` to connect to zookeeper and check what subscription was created. Once you connect to zookeeper using `zookeeper-shell`, you can use the following command to list the subscriptions.

```
ls /managed-ledgers/<tenant>/<namespace>/persistent/<topic>
```

If you find the actual subscription name, you can run `rmr /managed-ledgers/<tenant>/<namespace>/persistent/<topic>/<sub>` to delete the malformed subscription.

Regarding your first question - "Does anyone have any good theories on how a subscription (or a topic/namespace for that matter) could be created like this? "

I am guessing the error was introduced when using some command-line tools.

My management selected Kafka, I wanted Pulsar. So, Im stuck with Kafka for messaging. I need Pulsar Schema Registry (it supports every format I need). I need to know how to integrate the product with Kafka as a Schema Registry?

From: Sijie Guo <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Monday, April 6, 2020 1:32 PM
To: apache/pulsar <pulsar@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Steven Meadows <steven.meadows@us.abb.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [apache/pulsar] Kafka integration Pulsar Schema Registry (#6677)

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.


@smeadows-abb<https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fsmeadows-abb&data=02%7C01%7Csteven.meadows%40us.abb.com%7Cd799be303d8042ef832e08d7da506a77%7C372ee9e09ce04033a64ac07073a91ecd%7C0%7C0%7C637217911224264885&sdata=1szjuWxJfvdvfGEJGflqSAUEXpKmFRga1iCD2HPRM7E%3D&reserved=0> thank you for raising this feature request! Do you mean using "Pulsar Schema Registry" for Kafka? Can you explain more about your use cases?

whether Pulsar schema registry will provide support for Golang client

The c-go pulsar client already supports schema. The native go client pulsar-client-go<https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fapache%2Fpulsar-client-go&data=02%7C01%7Csteven.meadows%40us.abb.com%7Cd799be303d8042ef832e08d7da506a77%7C372ee9e09ce04033a64ac07073a91ecd%7C0%7C0%7C637217911224264885&sdata=7q6HNXSiO83j7ZE8Ov4tkco75K3D0CTqyJZgcKyijcM%3D&reserved=0> doesn't support schema yet. But it is in the roadmap. Hopefully, we can get that out in next native go client release.


You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fapache%2Fpulsar%2Fissues%2F6677%23issuecomment-609932671&data=02%7C01%7Csteven.meadows%40us.abb.com%7Cd799be303d8042ef832e08d7da506a77%7C372ee9e09ce04033a64ac07073a91ecd%7C0%7C0%7C637217911224264885&sdata=kJB97yEUrxvIGbN4gdrEqXFDILkT5Woz04I8qlBl0L8%3D&reserved=0>, or unsubscribe<https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fnotifications%2Funsubscribe-auth%2FAO2FTHKYY3ULBKZN3BBUMH3RLIGZBANCNFSM4MCONFTA&data=02%7C01%7Csteven.meadows%40us.abb.com%7Cd799be303d8042ef832e08d7da506a77%7C372ee9e09ce04033a64ac07073a91ecd%7C0%7C0%7C637217911224274877&sdata=OTTT7z9CUeuGEu%2B5yZVqcca9j4RcL7qBxt617pU0bzY%3D&reserved=0>.

@Esakkimuthu991 

What version of the Kafka cluster are you running? What version of Pulsar are you using?

@smeadows-abb I see. Currently, the Pulsar schema registry wasn't exposed as a standalone service yet. If you want to use it, you can still use it. 

You can use the schema restful API to create/retrieve/update the schema: http://pulsar.apache.org/admin-rest-api/?version=2.5.0#operation/postSchema

What you need is just write a Kafka serializer and deserializer to use Pulsar schema library. We did a similar thing that wraps Kafka serializer and deserializer into a Pulsar schema. You just need to do the reverse thing - wrap Pulsar schema into Kafka serializer and deserializer.

I am attaching one example for your reference - https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/client/kafka/compat/PulsarKafkaSchema.java
@david-streamlio sorry for the late response. @jiazhai @codelipenghui and @gaoran10 can you guys review this pull request? @david-streamlio is waiting for a review.
@russorat you are welcome! More contributions are welcome!
Close for now, the best solution would be to write an AuthorizationProvider that take a list of AuthorizationProviders. No code to change, just add a master authz provider.
Finally, the goal is not a support multiple authz provider, but create an authz provider that supports others.
You can unassign this for now.
@codelipenghui I hava addressed your comment, please help to take a look, thanks.
